page.title: 09Changing Times cont.
page.content: The village was very self-sufficient having it's own shoe maker and repairer; coal depot; wagonette service; 2 baker and grocery shops; the post office which sold everything from stamps to dress materials, which also baked bread on the premises; 2 butcher shops, one of which had a slaughterhouse adjoining; 2 pubs - The Portcullis which then had a thatched roof, The Fleece now extended by incorporating the next door cottage; the blacksmiths forge, horses coming from many miles around to be shod. Entertainment was not sitting around watching television, but rehearsing and taking part with the Dramatic Society; the Choral Society; the Band of Hope or concerts held quite often in the school, so all enjoyment was created by everyone so there was no time to be bored.
